Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix user locks. Broken some time ago for all platforms by Windows-related changes.

It also might require > creating a merged heap/index data file so an index lookup would > automatically access the heap data too.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update win32 comments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update wording: < This would require some background daemon to maintain clustering > This might require some background daemon to maintain clustering 397,398c397,398 < paritally filled for easier reorganization. It also might require < creating a merged heap/index data file so an index lookup would > paritally filled for easier reorganization. Another idea would > be to create a merged heap/index data file so an index lookup would

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Introduce local hash table for lock state, as per recent proposal. PROCLOCK structs in shared memory now have only a bitmask for held locks, rather than counts (making them 40 bytes smaller, which is a good thing). Multiple locks within a transaction are counted in the local hash table instead, and we have provision for tracking which ResourceOwner each count belongs to. Solves recently reported problem with memory leakage within long transactions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make gistindex_keytest safe against NULL values. Same fix was already made in passing for 8.0, but now that we have a bug report showing it's needed, we should put it into 7.4 branch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix Windows emulation of kill(pid, 0). This will now succeed, but only if the target PID is a PG postmaster or backend --- for our purposes that is actually better than the Unix behavior. Per Dave Page and Andrew Dunstan.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing semicolonSEMICOLON some bison versions warn of this.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Can't truncate pg_subtrans during a recovery checkpoint --- subtrans module isn't fully initialized yet.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Further tightening of the array literal parser. Prevent junk from being accepted after the outer right brace. Per report from Markus Bertheau. Also add regression test cases for this change, and for previous recent array literal parser changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix relcache to account properly for subtransaction status of 'new' relcache entries. Also, change TransactionIdIsCurrentTransactionId() so that if consulted during transaction abort, it will not say that the aborted xact is still current. (It would be better to ensure that it's never called at all during abort, but I'm not sure we can easily guarantee that.) In combination, these fix a crash we have seen occasionally during parallel regression tests of 8.0.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use dynamic buffer for token buffer in win32 admin check Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > > Another issue is that when installing the Postgres service with > > "pg_ctl register -w ...." the "-w" parameter was not put in > the registry "ImagePath" > > value for the Postgres service. (I added it manually to test.) So I > > suspect that "pg_ctl register" will need to be enhanced to add the > > "-w" parameter to the registry settings. Dave Page

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange order of operations in heap_drop_with_catalog and index_drop so that we close and flush the doomed relation's relcache entry before we start to delete the underlying catalog rows, rather than afterwards. For awhile yesterday I thought that an unexpected relcache entry rebuild partway through this sequence might explain the infrequent parallel regression failures we were chasing. It doesn't, mainly because there's no CommandCounterIncrement in the sequence and so the deletions aren't "really" done yet. But it sure seems like trouble waiting to happen.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Prevent pg_ctl restart from adding -D datadir multiple times.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove contrib/rserv, since there are better replication solutions available elsewhere (including a descendant project on gborg).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing Assert to make TransactionIdDidAbort more consistent with TransactionIdDidCommit.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Propogate pg_ctl -D to the postmaster for command-line identification.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that TransactionIdDidAbort doesn't think it should try to modify pg_clog, there's no reason to do abort marking of subtransactions in a nonintuitive order.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add regression tests for ALTER INDEX. Gavin Sherry

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix high-bit comparison compiler warning in pg_dump. Philip Warner

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Am Dienstag, 17. August 2004 14:26 schrieb Fabien COELHO: > > The patch adds missing the "libpgport.a" file to the installation under > > "install-all-headers". It is needed by some contribs. I install the > > library in "pkglibdir", but I was wondering whether it should be "libdir"? Please find attached a small patch against current CVS head that fixes pgport library installation so that it goes to libdir instead of pkglibdir. It works for me. Fabien Coelho

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch improves pg_ctl's win32 service code to eliminate some possible causes of the stale postmaster.pid problem that some users have reported. - The service did not properly report that it accepts SERVICE_CONTROL_SHUTDOWN events, thus it's possible the SCM simply killed the postmaster on shutdown. - 'WaitHints' are now given to the SCM to prevent it timing out if pg_ctl doesn't respond to a control event quickly enough. - During shutdown, the service checkpoint counter is incremented every five seconds for up to a minute to prevent the SCM timing out and assuming the service is not responding. Dave Page

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: >>> I understand your disliking of non-posix stuff. OTOH, >>GetLastError will >>> give much more details than errno. >> >>How much more, really? That mapping table gave me the impression that >>the win32 error codes aren't all that much more detailed than errno... > >The mapping table is not complete. My winerror.h from the SDK >lists 2209 >error codes, whereas errno.h lists 42... > >I still don't think we'll get that much more stuff. Right now, >the Win32 >code paths that actually use the more advanced functions already write >out the error number in case something happens. We can keep doing that >for the other paths (ereport the error *number* when the mapping does >not have a match). The map to errno will catch almost all cases, I >think. And in the corner cases we can do with just the number, and use >"net helpmsg" to get the actual message when checking... Here's an attempt on this. new file goes in backend/port/win32. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add comment on palloc use and DLLIMPORT>

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Several Cygwin fixes pointed out by Reini Urban.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add hint about using GRANT with non-trusted languages. James William Pye

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Adjust regression expected file for new grant language hint.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for postmaster.c function win32_waitpid(int *exitstatus) call to Win32 WaitForMultipleObjects: ret = WaitForMultipleObjects(win32_numChildren, win32_childHNDArray, FALSE, 0)SEMICOLON Problem is 'win32_numChildren' could be more then 64 ( function supports ), problem basically arise ( kills postgres ) when you create more then 64 connections and terminate some of them sill leaving more then 64. Claudio Natoli

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update copyright to 2004.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update with new typedefs. Remove java and c++ parts of readme.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pgindent run for 8.0.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Widen xl_len field of XLogRecord header to 32 bits, so that we'll have a more tolerable limit on the number of subtransactions or deleted files in COMMIT and ABORT records. Buy back the extra space by eliminating the xl_xact_prev field, which isn't being used for anything and is rather unlikely ever to be used for anything. This does not force initdb, but you do need to do pg_resetxlog if you want to upgrade an existing 8.0 installation without initdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace bcopy by memmove for more portability.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update typedefs with /lib info.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add WAL logging for CREATE/DROP DATABASE and CREATE/DROP TABLESPACE. Fix TablespaceCreateDbspace() to be able to create a dummy directory in place of a dropped tablespace's symlink. This eliminates the open problem of a PANIC during WAL replay when a replayed action attempts to touch a file in a since-deleted tablespace. It also makes for a significant improvement in the usability of PITR replay.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add explicit note that empty-string array element values now have to be written with quotes. Minor copy-editing too.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add note that contrib/rserv is gone.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Another pgindent run with lib typedefs added.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 service capability to pg_autovacuum. Dave Page

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Dept. of second thoughts: it'd be a good idea to flush buffers during replay of CREATE DATABASE as well as the first time around. Else it's possible that the copy operation will copy obsolete blocks. We are still a long way from guaranteeing anything about using a recently-written database as a CREATE template, but this seems needed to ensure the existing behavior holds up during replay.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak md.c logic to cope with the situation where WAL replay tries to write into a high-numbered segment of a relation that was later deleted. We need to temporarily recreate missing segment files, instead of failing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove item because it is on the open item list: < * Fix oid2name and dbsize for tablespaces

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure to advance nextXID beyond subtransactions whose XIDs appear only within COMMIT or ABORT records.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that the remainder of the current pg_clog page is zeroed during startup, just to be sure that there's no leftover junk there.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix obviously-utterly-untested noTocComments code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rather than referring to src/tutorial/README, put the build instructions for the tutorial files right here.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid ambiguity, as per suggestion from Peter Stricker.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: slock_t must be int not char for MIPS. 7.4 got this right, but the info was apparently mistranscribed in s_lock code rearrangement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve spinlock selftest to make it able to detect misdeclaration of the slock_t datatype (ie, declared type smaller than what the hardware TAS instruction needs).

Document.author: pgsql
Document.document: tag configure beta2

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace log_filename_prefix with more general log_filename parameter, to allow DBA to choose the form in which log filenames reflect the current time. Also allow for truncating instead of appending to pre-existing files --- this is convenient when the log filename pattern rewrites the same names cyclically. Per Ed L.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix typo in lstat() macro exposed by new tablespace code.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Define lstat with parameters, rather than just redefining the symbol.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: copy_relation_data was mistakenly assuming that the source relation would always be already open at the smgr level. Per bug report from Fabien Coelho.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: FlushRelationBuffers was also being a bit cavalier about whether the relation is already opened by smgr.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix unintended assignment of sequences to the containing schema's default tablespace --- they should always go in the database's default tablespace. Adjust heap_create() API so that it is passed the relkind to make this easierSEMICOLON should simplify any further tweaking of the same sort.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for various recent GUC hacking. Don't elog(ERROR) when not supposed to (fixes problem with postmaster aborting due to mistaken postgresql.conf change)SEMICOLON don't call superuser() when not inside a transaction (fixes coredump when, eg, try to set log_statement from PGOPTIONS)SEMICOLON some message style guidelines enforcement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for recent changes in guc-file.l. Avoid multiple frees, use of already-freed strings, other silliness. Also fix reporting of config file syntax errors so that it actually works reasonably well (eg, points at the correct line). Use palloc instead of malloc for temporary storage to reduce code clutter.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair 'expected both swapped tables to have TOAST tables' bug in 7.4 branch. I wasn't excited about doing this when the first report came in, but now that we have two of 'em, I suppose it had better get fixed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: needs_toast_table() should ignore dropped columns.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: src/bin/psql/tab-complete.c =~ s/CONVERSATION/CONVERSION/SEMICOLON Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: momjian
Document.document:
Add index mention:

In pre-8.0 releases, indexes often can not be used unless the data types exactly match the index's column types. This is particularly true of int2, int8, and numeric column indexes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a note about the difference between Postgres' treatment of the rights of an object owner and the SQL spec's treatment of these rights.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix mistaken comment.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Realign libpq and psql for need for path.c under Win32 VC and BCC.

Document.document: Fix bcc to compile libpq by creating include file for path.c.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak prettyprinting rules for saner indenting of UNION, INTERSECT, EXCEPT constructs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove obsolete comment.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The current implementation of dbsize doesn't handle tables in tablespaces correctly, and is quite restricted on objects covered (only tables and databases, but not tablespaces and indexes). The attached patch contributes: - database_size(name) - relation_size(text) These are the well-known functions, tablespace-aware. - pg_tablespace_size(oid) - pg_database_size(oid) - pg_relation_size(oid) Tablespace-aware implementations, used by the upper functions. pg_relation_size will report sizes of indexes as well. - pg_size_pretty(bigint) Formatting of sizes, to display '146MB' instead of '152885668' Andreas Pflug

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch attempts to fix the issue with localized timezones on Windows. Recap: When running on a localized windows version, the timezone name returned is also localized, and therefor does not match our lookup table. Solution: The registry contains both the name of the timezone in english and the localized name. The patch adds code to scan the registry for the localized name and gets the english name from that, and then rescans the table. I have tested this on a Swedish WinXP, and it works without problems. The registry layout is the same in Win2k, but I haven't specifically tested it. It's also the same on different languages but again only Swedish is tested. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out timezone detection patch. Tom already applied it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Consider using hash buckets to do DISTINCT, rather than sorting > > This would be beneficial when there are few distinct values.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove useless variable.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add s_lock support for HPUX on IA64, per Shinji Teragaito.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cope with recent HPUX versions providing isfinite() instead of finite().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: FAQ_HPUX updates from Shinji Teragaito.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix getrusage() emulation on Windows. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Spelling correction, per Greg Mullane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Yet another place where someone was being careless about the arguments of <ctype.h> macros.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Yet another place where someone was being careless about the arguments of <ctype.h> macros.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Some versions of lex will drop a lex.yy.c file when we probe to see if they are flex. Clean up after them.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix ancient declaration inconsistency in cube & seg ... came across a compiler that warns about it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apparently HPUX runs the IA64 in big-endian mode.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix shared library linking operations to work properly on all (or at least more) combinations of HP-UX hardware, compiler, and linker. Shinji Teragaito and Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak elog.c's logic for promoting errors into more severe errors. Messages of less than ERROR severity should never be promoted (this fixes Gaetano Mendola's problem with a COMMERROR becoming a PANIC, and is obvious in hindsight anyway). Do all promotion in errstart not errfinish, to ensure that output decisions are made correctlySEMICOLON the former coding could suppress logging of promoted errors, which doesn't seem like a good idea. Eliminate some redundant code too.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: On further consideration, there's another problem here: the existing elog() emulation code always calls errstart with ERROR error level. This means that a recursive error call triggered by elog would do MemoryContextReset(ErrorContext), whether or not this was actually appropriate. I'm surprised we haven't seen this in the field...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Simplify IsXactIsoLevelSerializable test. A cycle saved is a cycle earned ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Downgrade LOG messages to DEBUG1 for normal recycling of xlog, clog, subtrans segments. Per Greg Mullane and Chris K-L.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault in Informix mode.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I can't see any good reason for DropRelFileNodeBuffers to be issuing FATAL when it detects a nonzero reference count. Reduce to ERROR.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix incorrect ordering of smgr cleanup relative to buffer pin cleanup during transaction abort. Add a regression test case to catch related mistakes in future. Alvaro Herrera and Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Guard against transaction control statements in SQL functions. This never worked, but it particularly doesn't work now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix to disallow BEGIN/COMMIT/ROLLBACK inside SQL functions. Not sure why this isn't causing serious problems in some simple tests, but it definitely isn't going to do anything desirable...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a number of places where brittle data structures or overly strong Asserts would lead to a server core dump if an error occurred while trying to abort a failed subtransaction (thereby leading to re-execution of whatever parts of AbortSubTransaction had already run). This of course does not prevent such an error from creating an infinite loop, but at least we don't make the situation worse. Responds to an open item on the subtransactions to-do list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix error in Windows version of CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS macro. This prevented statement_timeout from working. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix places where WaitForxxx can block, to eliminate failure to detect deadlock on Win32. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a couple of small errors in trigger-list management, as per recent discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve README with mention of new functions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use _timezone global on Cygwin instead of timezone.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clarify description of SET CONSTRAINTS. Point out that it is still missing the ability to schema-qualify constraint names.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor efficiency improvements in keeping track of trigger deferred status. In particular, I see no reason for deferredTriggerCheckState to make an explicit entry to note that a particular trigger has its default state --- that just clutters a list that should normally be empty or very short. I have plans to revise this module much more heavily, but this is a simple separable improvement.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make TZNAME_GLOBAL for reference to tzname global variable.

Document.document: Fix Cygwin defines to be consistent.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: psql consistency fixes from Greg Sabino Mullane: have BACKSLASHdf show schema and name first, make sure BACKSLASHdi+ shows description last, and make BACKSLASHdl SQL look a little more standard.

Document.document: Apply patch from Steven Singer for contrib/dbmirror. Changes: -It fixes up some bugs with handling setval calls -Adds upgrade instructions from prior versions -Improved the sample config file -Fixed some things in the clean_pending script

Document.document: Fix two typos in comments.

Document.document: Use $PORTNAME consistently instead of $host_os, where appropriate.

Document.document: More cleanup.

Document.document: Minor cleanup.

Document.document: Properly include port file for Cygwin.

Document.document: Fix palloc call from /port for Cygwin.

Document.document: Fix #if define

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Make row-wise comparisons work per SQL spec >

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fire non-deferred AFTER triggers immediately upon query completion, rather than when returning to the idle loop. This makes no particular difference for interactively-issued queries, but it makes a big difference for queries issued within functions: trigger execution now occurs before the calling function is allowed to proceed. This responds to numerous complaints about nonintuitive behavior of foreign key checking, such as http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-bugs/2004-09/msg00020.php, and appears to be required by the SQL99 spec. Also take the opportunity to simplify the data structures used for the pending-trigger list, rename them for more clarity, and squeeze out a bit of space.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some problems with restoring databases owned by non-superusers, as per bug #1249SEMICOLON and remove the last vestiges of using BACKSLASHconnect to change authorization.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Done: < * Have AFTER triggers execute after the appropriate SQL statement in a > * -Have AFTER triggers execute after the appropriate SQL statement in a

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Check for ignored thread compiler options to reduce compiler noise.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Send thread test output to file descriptor 5 like configure does rather than /dev/null, which Win32 doesn't have.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that pg_largeobject references opened by lo_import() or lo_export() will be cleaned up at end of transaction, even when there is no other LO operation in the transaction. Per bug report from Daniel Schuchardt.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix bogus example for bit-string XOR (already fixed in HEAD). Per Grzegorz Wojdyla.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Renumber SnapshotNow and the other special snapshot codes so that ((Snapshot) NULL) can no longer be confused with a valid snapshot, as per my recent suggestion. Define a macro InvalidSnapshot for 0. Use InvalidSnapshot instead of SnapshotAny as the do-nothing special case for heap_update and heap_delete crosschecksSEMICOLON this seems a little cleaner even though the behavior is really the same.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When LockAcquire fails at the stage of creating a proclock object, be sure to clean up the already-created lock object, if it has no other references. Avoids possibly-permanent leak of shared memory.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove code that delete braces around single statements.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Re-add brace removal code but comment it out so we know why we removed it and have it in case we need it for some special case.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Fix two typos in comments.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Fix two typos in comments.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Due to popular domand, backport fix for a typo in the SELECT reference page, per Thomas F. O'Connell.

Document.author: jurka
Document.document: ResultSet.moveToCurrentRow was checking the cached updateability flag assuming it had been set instead of correctly calling the isUpdateable() method which sets the flag if needed. This usually worked because moveToCurrentRow is only useful after a moveToInsertRow call which would set the flag, but this is not required. David Bucciarelli

Document.author: jurka
Document.document: Protected access to variable m_preparedCount via synchronized function to prevent multiple threads using automatic cursors on the same connection from stomping over each others cursor. Originally Jan Wieck, re-reported by Jack Orenstein after accidental removal.

Document.document: Translation updates

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Redesign query-snapshot timing so that volatile functions in READ COMMITTED mode see a fresh snapshot for each command in the function, rather than using the latest interactive command's snapshot. Also, suppress fresh snapshots as well as CommandCounterIncrement inside STABLE and IMMUTABLE functions, instead using the snapshot taken for the most closely nested regular query. (This behavior is only sane for read-only functions, so the patch also enforces that such functions contain only SELECT commands.) As per my proposal of 6-Sep-2004SEMICOLON I note that I floated essentially the same proposal on 19-Jun-2002, but that discussion tailed off without any action. Since 8.0 seems like the right place to be taking possibly nontrivial backwards compatibility hits, let's get it done now.

Document.document: Fix some minor issues with the new Win32 service code for autovacuum, and add documentation. Dave Page

Document.document: New translation

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mark as done: < * Point-in-time data recovery using backup and write-ahead log, < * Create native Win32 port, http://momjian.postgresql.org/main/writings/pgsql/project/win32.html > * -Point-in-time data recovery using backup and write-ahead log > * -Create native Win32 port 470c470 < o Fix PL/pgSQL RENAME to work on variables other than OLD/NEW > o Fix PL/pgSQL RENAME to work on variables other than OLD/NEW

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Cosmetic PL/PgSQL fix: declare the second parameter plpgsql_dstring_append as a const char *, so that we don't need to cast away a const in gram.y

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Fix a read of uninitialized memory in array_out(). Perform some minor cosmetic code cleanup at the same time.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Minor doc tweak: mention that function names can be optionally schema- qualified.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure subtransaction handling to reduce resource consumption, as per recent discussions. Invent SubTransactionIds that are managed like CommandIds (ie, counter is reset at start of each top transaction), and use these instead of TransactionIds to keep track of subtransaction status in those modules that need it. This means that a subtransaction does not need an XID unless it actually inserts/modifies rows in the database. Accordingly, don't assign it an XID nor take a lock on the XID until it tries to do that. This saves a lot of overhead for subtransactions that are only used for error recovery (eg plpgsql exceptions). Also, arrange to release a subtransaction's XID lock as soon as the subtransaction exits, in both the commit and abort cases. This avoids holding many unique locks after a long series of subtransactions. The price is some additional overhead in XactLockTableWait, but that seems acceptable. Finally, restructure the state machine in xact.c to have a more orthogonal set of states for subtransactions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: RecentXmin is too recent to use as the cutoff point for accessing pg_subtrans --- what we need is the oldest xmin of any snapshot in use in the current top transaction. Introduce a new variable TransactionXmin to play this role. Fixes intermittent regression failure reported by Neil Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add some marginal tweaks to eliminate memory leakages associated with subtransactions. Trivial subxacts (such as a plpgsql exception block containing no database access) now demonstrably leak zero bytes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove erroneous Assert, per example from Kris Jurka.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove contrib/pg_logger, per recent discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix oversight: there's no reason for PG_TRY to use sigsetjmp(buf,1) since we don't change the signal mask during normal backend operations. Use sigsetjmp(buf,0) to avoid many unnecessary kernel calls.

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Make discovery of python_configdir architecture independent. Solution from James William Pye.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Hyperlink a reference to DROP CAST in the CREATE CAST reference page.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that xmax and cmin are distinct fields again, we should zero xmax when creating a new tuple. This is just for debugging sanity, though, since nothing should be paying any attention to xmax when the HEAP_XMAX_INVALID bit is set.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clarify description of SET CONSTRAINTS. Point out that it is still missing the ability to schema-qualify constraint names.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Some versions of lex will drop a lex.yy.c file when we probe to see if they are flex. Clean up after them.

Document.document: needs_toast_table() should ignore dropped columns.

Document.document: Avoid ambiguity, as per suggestion from Peter Stricker.

Document.document: Another pgindent run with lib typedefs added.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Am Dienstag, 17. August 2004 14:26 schrieb Fabien COELHO: > > The patch adds missing the "libpgport.a" file to the installation under > > "install-all-headers". It is needed by some contribs. I install the > > library in "pkglibdir", but I was wondering whether it should be "libdir"? Please find attached a small patch against current CVS head that fixes pgport library installation so that it goes to libdir instead of pkglibdir. It works for me. Fabien Coelho

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Re-add brace removal code but comment it out so we know why we removed it and have it in case we need it for some special case.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that pg_largeobject references opened by lo_import() or lo_export() will be cleaned up at end of transaction, even when there is no other LO operation in the transaction. Per bug report from Daniel Schuchardt.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a number of places where brittle data structures or overly strong Asserts would lead to a server core dump if an error occurred while trying to abort a failed subtransaction (thereby leading to re-execution of whatever parts of AbortSubTransaction had already run). This of course does not prevent such an error from creating an infinite loop, but at least we don't make the situation worse. Responds to an open item on the subtransactions to-do list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Guard against transaction control statements in SQL functions. This never worked, but it particularly doesn't work now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I can't see any good reason for DropRelFileNodeBuffers to be issuing FATAL when it detects a nonzero reference count. Reduce to ERROR.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix obviously-utterly-untested noTocComments code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure to advance nextXID beyond subtransactions whose XIDs appear only within COMMIT or ABORT records.

Document.document: Fix oversight: there's no reason for PG_TRY to use sigsetjmp(buf,1) since we don't change the signal mask during normal backend operations. Use sigsetjmp(buf,0) to avoid many unnecessary kernel calls.

Document.document: Fix a read of uninitialized memory in array_out(). Perform some minor cosmetic code cleanup at the same time.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove a stray reference to sequences as having tablespaces.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix unintended assignment of sequences to the containing schema's default tablespace --- they should always go in the database's default tablespace. Adjust heap_create() API so that it is passed the relkind to make this easierSEMICOLON should simplify any further tweaking of the same sort.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add hint about using GRANT with non-trusted languages. James William Pye

Document.document: Add comment on palloc use and DLLIMPORT>

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing Assert to make TransactionIdDidAbort more consistent with TransactionIdDidCommit.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update documentation to prefer CIDR format for pg_hba.conf and use new CIDR column in examples first.

Document.author: jurka
Document.document: ResultSet.moveToCurrentRow was checking the cached updateability flag assuming it had been set instead of correctly calling the isUpdateable() method which sets the flag if needed. This usually worked because moveToCurrentRow is only useful after a moveToInsertRow call which would set the flag, but this is not required. David Bucciarelli

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When LockAcquire fails at the stage of creating a proclock object, be sure to clean up the already-created lock object, if it has no other references. Avoids possibly-permanent leak of shared memory.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cope with recent HPUX versions providing isfinite() instead of finite().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove obsolete comment.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Whack Wisconsin benchmark around until it actually works again. It's still useless because it tests a standalone backend, but at least the bit rot is repaired.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add note that contrib/rserv is gone.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make gistindex_keytest safe against NULL values. Same fix was already made in passing for 8.0, but now that we have a bug report showing it's needed, we should put it into 7.4 branch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Introduce local hash table for lock state, as per recent proposal. PROCLOCK structs in shared memory now have only a bitmask for held locks, rather than counts (making them 40 bytes smaller, which is a good thing). Multiple locks within a transaction are counted in the local hash table instead, and we have provision for tracking which ResourceOwner each count belongs to. Solves recently reported problem with memory leakage within long transactions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: New Win32 wording that mentions "code".

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New translations

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix #if define

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The current implementation of dbsize doesn't handle tables in tablespaces correctly, and is quite restricted on objects covered (only tables and databases, but not tablespaces and indexes). The attached patch contributes: - database_size(name) - relation_size(text) These are the well-known functions, tablespace-aware. - pg_tablespace_size(oid) - pg_database_size(oid) - pg_relation_size(oid) Tablespace-aware implementations, used by the upper functions. pg_relation_size will report sizes of indexes as well. - pg_size_pretty(bigint) Formatting of sizes, to display '146MB' instead of '152885668' Andreas Pflug

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair 'expected both swapped tables to have TOAST tables' bug in 7.4 branch. I wasn't excited about doing this when the first report came in, but now that we have two of 'em, I suppose it had better get fixed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add WAL logging for CREATE/DROP DATABASE and CREATE/DROP TABLESPACE. Fix TablespaceCreateDbspace() to be able to create a dummy directory in place of a dropped tablespace's symlink. This eliminates the open problem of a PANIC during WAL replay when a replayed action attempts to touch a file in a since-deleted tablespace. It also makes for a significant improvement in the usability of PITR replay.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix user locks. Broken some time ago for all platforms by Windows-related changes.

Document.author: tgl

Document.document: Add some marginal tweaks to eliminate memory leakages associated with subtransactions. Trivial subxacts (such as a plpgsql exception block containing no database access) now demonstrably leak zero bytes.

Document.author: jurka
Document.document: Protected access to variable m_preparedCount via synchronized function to prevent multiple threads using automatic cursors on the same connection from stomping over each others cursor. Originally Jan Wieck, re-reported by Jack Orenstein after accidental removal.

Another idea would > be to create a merged heap/index data file so an index lookup would

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: FAQ_HPUX updates from Shinji Teragaito.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak md.c logic to cope with the situation where WAL replay tries to write into a high-numbered segment of a relation that was later deleted. We need to temporarily recreate missing segment files, instead of failing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: >>> I understand your disliking of non-posix stuff. OTOH, >>GetLastError will >>> give much more details than errno. >> >>How much more, really? That mapping table gave me the impression that >>the win32 error codes aren't all that much more detailed than errno... > >The mapping table is not complete. My winerror.h from the SDK >lists 2209 >error codes, whereas errno.h lists 42... > >I still don't think we'll get that much more stuff. Right now, >the Win32 >code paths that actually use the more advanced functions already write >out the error number in case something happens. We can keep doing that >for the other paths (ereport the error *number* when the mapping does >not have a match). The map to errno will catch almost all cases, I >think. And in the corner cases we can do with just the number, and use >"net helpmsg" to get the actual message when checking... Here's an attempt on this. new file goes in backend/port/win32. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Can't truncate pg_subtrans during a recovery checkpoint --- subtrans module isn't fully initialized yet.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update win32 comments.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix memory leak in tokenize_file, per report from Vadim Passynkov.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix memory leak in tokenize_file, per report from Vadim Passynkov.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Fix small memory leak in psql.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move undef of rename/unlink so system declarations are unmodified.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move TIMEZONE_GLOBAL out into the proper place.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix error in Windows version of CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS macro. This prevented statement_timeout from working. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix bcc to compile libpq by creating include file for path.c.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace bcopy by memmove for more portability.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Adjust regression expected file for new grant language hint.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Propogate pg_ctl -D to the postmaster for command-line identification.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Prevent pg_ctl restart from adding -D datadir multiple times.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange order of operations in heap_drop_with_catalog and index_drop so that we close and flush the doomed relation's relcache entry before we start to delete the underlying catalog rows, rather than afterwards. For awhile yesterday I thought that an unexpected relcache entry rebuild partway through this sequence might explain the infrequent parallel regression failures we were chasing. It doesn't, mainly because there's no CommandCounterIncrement in the sequence and so the deletions aren't "really" done yet. But it sure seems like trouble waiting to happen.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use dynamic buffer for token buffer in win32 admin check Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix Windows emulation of kill(pid, 0). This will now succeed, but only if the target PID is a PG postmaster or backend --- for our purposes that is actually better than the Unix behavior. Per Dave Page and Andrew Dunstan.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Move comment at end of line to a separate line so trailing tabs don't become part of the make variable value.

Document.document: Add: > * Make row-wise comparisons work per SQL spec >

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apparently HPUX runs the IA64 in big-endian mode.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove line specifying Andreas as author.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add code to be able to match the timezone name on localized Windows systems. Magnus Hagander.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document:
Add index mention:

In pre-8.0 releases, indexes often can not be used unless the data types exactly match the index's column types. This is particularly true of int2, int8, and numeric column indexes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve spinlock selftest to make it able to detect misdeclaration of the slock_t datatype (ie, declared type smaller than what the hardware TAS instruction needs).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove contrib/rserv, since there are better replication solutions available elsewhere (including a descendant project on gborg).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing semicolonSEMICOLON some bison versions warn of this.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.document: Hashed LEFT JOIN would miss outer tuples with no inner match if the join was large enough to be batched and the tuples fell into a batch where there were no inner tuples at all. Thanks to Xiaoyu Wang for finding a test case that exposed this long-standing bug.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove erroneous Assert, per example from Kris Jurka.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a couple of small errors in trigger-list management, as per recent discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix mistaken comment.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove item because it is on the open item list: < * Fix oid2name and dbsize for tablespaces

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix high-bit comparison compiler warning in pg_dump. Philip Warner

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Further tightening of the array literal parser. Prevent junk from being accepted after the outer right brace. Per report from Markus Bertheau. Also add regression test cases for this change, and for previous recent array literal parser changes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Create pg_config_paths in port/ for win32 builds of psql.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix incorrect ordering of smgr cleanup relative to buffer pin cleanup during transaction abort. Add a regression test case to catch related mistakes in future. Alvaro Herrera and Tom Lane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Yet another place where someone was being careless about the arguments of <ctype.h> macros.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Yet another place where someone was being careless about the arguments of <ctype.h> macros.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Spelling correction, per Greg Mullane.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: FlushRelationBuffers was also being a bit cavalier about whether the relation is already opened by smgr.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Widen xl_len field of XLogRecord header to 32 bits, so that we'll have a more tolerable limit on the number of subtransactions or deleted files in COMMIT and ABORT records. Buy back the extra space by eliminating the xl_xact_prev field, which isn't being used for anything and is rather unlikely ever to be used for anything. This does not force initdb, but you do need to do pg_resetxlog if you want to upgrade an existing 8.0 installation without initdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix relcache to account properly for subtransaction status of 'new' relcache entries. Also, change TransactionIdIsCurrentTransactionId() so that if consulted during transaction abort, it will not say that the aborted xact is still current. (It would be better to ensure that it's never called at all during abort, but I'm not sure we can easily guarantee that.) In combination, these fix a crash we have seen occasionally during parallel regression tests of 8.0.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add support for GNU/Hurd and GNU/*BSD. For our purposes, they behave just like LinuxSEMICOLON we just need to recognize the system types.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Renumber SnapshotNow and the other special snapshot codes so that ((Snapshot) NULL) can no longer be confused with a valid snapshot, as per my recent suggestion. Define a macro InvalidSnapshot for 0. Use InvalidSnapshot instead of SnapshotAny as the do-nothing special case for heap_update and heap_delete crosschecksSEMICOLON this seems a little cleaner even though the behavior is really the same.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix places where WaitForxxx can block, to eliminate failure to detect deadlock on Win32. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix shared library linking operations to work properly on all (or at least more) combinations of HP-UX hardware, compiler, and linker. Shinji Teragaito and Tom Lane.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: src/bin/psql/tab-complete.c =~ s/CONVERSATION/CONVERSION/SEMICOLON Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pgindent run for 8.0.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > > Another issue is that when installing the Postgres service with > > "pg_ctl register -w ...." the "-w" parameter was not put in > the registry "ImagePath" > > value for the Postgres service. (I added it manually to test.) So I > > suspect that "pg_ctl register" will need to be enhanced to add the > > "-w" parameter to the registry settings. Dave Page

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix estimate_num_groups to be able to use expression-index statistics when there is an expressional index matching a GROUP BY item.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Translation update

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix bogus example for bit-string XOR (already fixed in HEAD). Per Grzegorz Wojdyla.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fire non-deferred AFTER triggers immediately upon query completion, rather than when returning to the idle loop. This makes no particular difference for interactively-issued queries, but it makes a big difference for queries issued within functions: trigger execution now occurs before the calling function is allowed to proceed. This responds to numerous complaints about nonintuitive behavior of foreign key checking, such as http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-bugs/2004-09/msg00020.php, and appears to be required by the SQL99 spec. Also take the opportunity to simplify the data structures used for the pending-trigger list, rename them for more clarity, and squeeze out a bit of space.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up Cygwin test.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve README with mention of new functions.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault in Informix mode.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove useless variable.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Define lstat with parameters, rather than just redefining the symbol.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Dept. of second thoughts: it'd be a good idea to flush buffers during replay of CREATE DATABASE as well as the first time around. Else it's possible that the copy operation will copy obsolete blocks. We are still a long way from guaranteeing anything about using a recently-written database as a CREATE template, but this seems needed to ensure the existing behavior holds up during replay.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that TransactionIdDidAbort doesn't think it should try to modify pg_clog, there's no reason to do abort marking of subtransactions in a nonintuitive order.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: RecentXmin is too recent to use as the cutoff point for accessing pg_subtrans --- what we need is the oldest xmin of any snapshot in use in the current top transaction. Introduce a new variable TransactionXmin to play this role. Fixes intermittent regression failure reported by Neil Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure subtransaction handling to reduce resource consumption, as per recent discussions. Invent SubTransactionIds that are managed like CommandIds (ie, counter is reset at start of each top transaction), and use these instead of TransactionIds to keep track of subtransaction status in those modules that need it. This means that a subtransaction does not need an XID unless it actually inserts/modifies rows in the database. Accordingly, don't assign it an XID nor take a lock on the XID until it tries to do that. This saves a lot of overhead for subtransactions that are only used for error recovery (eg plpgsql exceptions). Also, arrange to release a subtransaction's XID lock as soon as the subtransaction exits, in both the commit and abort cases. This avoids holding many unique locks after a long series of subtransactions. The price is some additional overhead in XactLockTableWait, but that seems acceptable. Finally, restructure the state machine in xact.c to have a more orthogonal set of states for subtransactions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak elog.c's logic for promoting errors into more severe errors. Messages of less than ERROR severity should never be promoted (this fixes Gaetano Mendola's problem with a COMMERROR becoming a PANIC, and is obvious in hindsight anyway). Do all promotion in errstart not errfinish, to ensure that output decisions are made correctlySEMICOLON the former coding could suppress logging of promoted errors, which doesn't seem like a good idea. Eliminate some redundant code too.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add regression tests for ALTER INDEX. Gavin Sherry

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put the brackets in the right places in timestamp entries in table 8-1. Spotted by Josh Purinton.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put the brackets in the right places in timestamp entries in table 8-1. Spotted by Josh Purinton.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New config.guess and config.sub

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some minor issues with the new Win32 service code for autovacuum, and add documentation. Dave Page

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix Cygwin defines to be consistent.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Use _timezone global on Cygwin instead of timezone.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix ancient declaration inconsistency in cube & seg ... came across a compiler that warns about it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use $PATH_SEPARATOR like the rest of the autoconf code, instead of hardwiring IFS=: when searching paths.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out Cygwin timezone change until we have a more global solution.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for various recent GUC hacking. Don't elog(ERROR) when not supposed to (fixes problem with postmaster aborting due to mistaken postgresql.conf change)SEMICOLON don't call superuser() when not inside a transaction (fixes coredump when, eg, try to set log_statement from PGOPTIONS)SEMICOLON some message style guidelines enforcement.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Win32 service capability to pg_autovacuum. Dave Page

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch improves pg_ctl's win32 service code to eliminate some possible causes of the stale postmaster.pid problem that some users have reported. - The service did not properly report that it accepts SERVICE_CONTROL_SHUTDOWN events, thus it's possible the SCM simply killed the postmaster on shutdown. - 'WaitHints' are now given to the SCM to prevent it timing out if pg_ctl doesn't respond to a control event quickly enough. - During shutdown, the service checkpoint counter is incremented every five seconds for up to a minute to prevent the SCM timing out and assuming the service is not responding. Dave Page

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove contrib/pg_logger, per recent discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mark as done: < * Point-in-time data recovery using backup and write-ahead log, < * Create native Win32 port, http://momjian.postgresql.org/main/writings/pgsql/project/win32.html > * -Point-in-time data recovery using backup and write-ahead log > * -Create native Win32 port 470c470 < o Fix PL/pgSQL RENAME to work on variables other than OLD/NEW > o Fix PL/pgSQL RENAME to work on variables other than OLD/NEW

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New translation

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust tsearch2.sql to avoid use of COPY FROM STDIN, so as to simplify life for the Win32 installer. Per Dave Page.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New translation

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: psql consistency fixes from Greg Sabino Mullane: have BACKSLASHdf show schema and name first, make sure BACKSLASHdi+ shows description last, and make BACKSLASHdl SQL look a little more standard.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: We don't use java in our compiles anymore so remove the filter test from pgtest.

Document.author: dennis
Document.document: Added a call to gettext() to fix broken translated error messages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Code review for recent changes in guc-file.l. Avoid multiple frees, use of already-freed strings, other silliness. Also fix reporting of config file syntax errors so that it actually works reasonably well (eg, points at the correct line). Use palloc instead of malloc for temporary storage to reduce code clutter.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: copy_relation_data was mistakenly assuming that the source relation would always be already open at the smgr level. Per bug report from Fabien Coelho.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rather than referring to src/tutorial/README, put the build instructions for the tutorial files right here.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Several Cygwin fixes pointed out by Reini Urban.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Here is a patch bringing oid2name into the 21st century. Alvaro Herrera

Document.author: joe
Document.document: Make discovery of python_configdir architecture independent. Solution from James William Pye.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix getrusage() emulation on Windows. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak prettyprinting rules for saner indenting of UNION, INTERSECT, EXCEPT constructs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace log_filename_prefix with more general log_filename parameter, to allow DBA to choose the form in which log filenames reflect the current time. Also allow for truncating instead of appending to pre-existing files --- this is convenient when the log filename pattern rewrites the same names cyclically. Per Ed L.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that the remainder of the current pg_clog page is zeroed during startup, just to be sure that there's no leftover junk there.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for postmaster.c function win32_waitpid(int *exitstatus) call to Win32 WaitForMultipleObjects: ret = WaitForMultipleObjects(win32_numChildren, win32_childHNDArray, FALSE, 0)SEMICOLON Problem is 'win32_numChildren' could be more then 64 ( function supports ), problem basically arise ( kills postgres ) when you create more then 64 connections and terminate some of them sill leaving more then 64. Claudio Natoli

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Redesign query-snapshot timing so that volatile functions in READ COMMITTED mode see a fresh snapshot for each command in the function, rather than using the latest interactive command's snapshot. Also, suppress fresh snapshots as well as CommandCounterIncrement inside STABLE and IMMUTABLE functions, instead using the snapshot taken for the most closely nested regular query. (This behavior is only sane for read-only functions, so the patch also enforces that such functions contain only SELECT commands.) As per my proposal of 6-Sep-2004SEMICOLON I note that I floated essentially the same proposal on 19-Jun-2002, but that discussion tailed off without any action. Since 8.0 seems like the right place to be taking possibly nontrivial backwards compatibility hits, let's get it done now.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Done: < * Have AFTER triggers execute after the appropriate SQL statement in a > * -Have AFTER triggers execute after the appropriate SQL statement in a

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix to disallow BEGIN/COMMIT/ROLLBACK inside SQL functions. Not sure why this isn't causing serious problems in some simple tests, but it definitely isn't going to do anything desirable...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Consider using hash buckets to do DISTINCT, rather than sorting > > This would be beneficial when there are few distinct values.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cast _timezone to int from time_t for Cygwin.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix typo in lstat() macro exposed by new tablespace code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add explicit note that empty-string array element values now have to be written with quotes. Minor copy-editing too.

Document.document: Update typedefs with /lib info.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make TZNAME_GLOBAL for reference to tzname global variable.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: On further consideration, there's another problem here: the existing elog() emulation code always calls errstart with ERROR error level. This means that a recursive error call triggered by elog would do MemoryContextReset(ErrorContext), whether or not this was actually appropriate. I'm surprised we haven't seen this in the field...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch attempts to fix the issue with localized timezones on Windows. Recap: When running on a localized windows version, the timezone name returned is also localized, and therefor does not match our lookup table. Solution: The registry contains both the name of the timezone in english and the localized name. The patch adds code to scan the registry for the localized name and gets the english name from that, and then rescans the table. I have tested this on a Swedish WinXP, and it works without problems. The registry layout is the same in Win2k, but I haven't specifically tested it. It's also the same on different languages but again only Swedish is tested. Magnus Hagander

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Realign libpq and psql for need for path.c under Win32 VC and BCC.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a note about the difference between Postgres' treatment of the rights of an object owner and the SQL spec's treatment of these rights.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: slock_t must be int not char for MIPS. 7.4 got this right, but the info was apparently mistranscribed in s_lock code rearrangement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that xmax and cmin are distinct fields again, we should zero xmax when creating a new tuple. This is just for debugging sanity, though, since nothing should be paying any attention to xmax when the HEAP_XMAX_INVALID bit is set.

Document.author: neilc
Document.document: Hyperlink a reference to DROP CAST in the CREATE CAST reference page.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some problems with restoring databases owned by non-superusers, as per bug #1249SEMICOLON and remove the last vestiges of using BACKSLASHconnect to change authorization.

Document.author: dennis
Document.document: Some source files was not scanned for translatable strings.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor efficiency improvements in keeping track of trigger deferred status. In particular, I see no reason for deferredTriggerCheckState to make an explicit entry to note that a particular trigger has its default state --- that just clutters a list that should normally be empty or very short. I have plans to revise this module much more heavily, but this is a simple separable improvement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Simplify IsXactIsoLevelSerializable test. A cycle saved is a cycle earned ...
